title: Punjab National Bank launches 34 new products on its 131st foundation day
desc: Punjab National Bank celebrated its 131st foundation day by launching 34 new products, including customer-centric deposit schemes and digital transformation initiatives. Financial Services Secretary M Nagaraju commended PNB's efforts to deepen financial inclusion and enhance customer experience. The bank also organized a 'Cyber Run' to promote cybersecurity awareness and safe digital banking practices.

title: Time for India’s agri-exporters to look beyond US to mitigate Trump’s tariffs, say experts, stakeholders
desc: Diversification into new markets and value-added products, along with infrastructure upgrades and support for MSMEs, are crucial for mitigating the impact and ensuring long-term competitiveness.

title: Daylight savings 2025: Donald Trump wants to stop moving clocks back one hour every autumn, cites THIS reason
desc: Daylight Saving Time was adopted by the federal government during World War I but was unpopular with farmers rushing to get produce to morning markets, and was quickly abolished.

title: Tariffs impact? Texas famers to immediately receive water from Mexico under over 80-year-old water sharing treaty, day after Donald Trump issued threat
desc: Mexico, which has fallen short on it deliveries under an 81-year-old water sharing treaty with the U.S.

title: After China, Trump threatens sanctions, tariffs on Mexico for 'stealing water'
desc: Donald Trump has threatened Mexico with sanctions and tariffs, accusing them of violating a 1944 water treaty and depriving Texas farmers of water. Mexico owes Texas 1.3 million acre-feet of water, but President Claudia Sheinbaum claims compliance is limited by drought. Mexico is scrambling to increase water deliveries amid concerns Trump could involve the dispute in trade negotiations.

title: Trump touts 'self-deport' campaign for migrants
desc: Donald Trump's administration unveils a self-deportation program. It encourages undocumented migrants to leave the US voluntarily. The goal is to facilitate their legal return later. A new app, CBP Home, aids this process. The government collaborates with El Salvador, Colombia, and Mexico. They will provide support to returning migrants. Farmers and hotels will get temporary migrant workers.

title: BSF to undertake mega IED detection drive along India-Pakistan border in Punjab
desc: Following the unprecedented discovery of IEDs along the Punjab border, which injured a BSF jawan, the Border Security Force will conduct extensive anti-IED sweeps across hundreds of kilometers. This action comes alongside the jurisdictional shift of 20.3 kilometers to the Jammu frontier for enhanced security coordination in riverine areas near Pathankot.

title: Pay Commission math doesn't work
desc: "Historically, pay commission recommendations have led to a fitment factor of around 2.8, implying that salaries could rise nearly 3x. To pre-empt accusations of bias, comparisons are often made between incomes of lower-grade gov employees and those of farmers."

title: Cabinet gives Rs 1,600 cr for sub-scheme of Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana
desc: The Indian Union Cabinet has approved the Modernization of Command Area Development and Water Management (M-CADWM) sub-scheme of the Pradhan Mantri Krishi Sinchayee Yojana (PMKSY) for 2025-26. The scheme aims to improve water use efficiency among farmers by modernizing irrigation water supply infrastructure, creating robust backend infrastructure for micro-irrigation systems, and leveraging SCADA systems and IoT technologies for real-time water accounting and management.

title: MrBeast criticises Trump tariffs, highlights impact on his chocolate brand Feastables
desc: Feastables is currently produced in both Peru and the US, but the company sources its cocoa internationally and ensures fair pay for farmers. “We pay our farmers a living income, use fair trade certified beans, etc. so I was already spending a lot on cocoa,” he said. “A random price hike was pretty brutal ngl.”

title: Revolution in the barn: AI-Powered agritech tackles India’s Rs 1.5-lakh crore post-harvest storage woes
desc: India loses 10% of its total food grain production post-harvest. The Delhi-based agri-logistic firm looks to minimise it through its digital warehouse management solution—Agri Reach

title: Congress passes seven-point resolution on Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel
desc: The Congress Working Committee, convening at the Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel Memorial, has resolved to emulate Patel's principles. The resolution highlights the differences between the BJP's policies and Patel's ideals, particularly concerning farmers' rights. Congress accuses the BJP government of mirroring oppressive British tactics against farmers and pledges to follow Patel's path of advocating for their rights.

title: Agritech startup AgroStar raises $6.7 million from Accel India, other existing backers
desc: Founded in 2013 by Sitanshu Sheth and Shardul Sheth, Pune-based AgroStar leverages data and technology to provide good quality agri-inputs to farmers and bridge the knowledge gap in farming practices. The company board has passed a resolution to issue 1,45,385 compulsory convertible non-cumulative preference shares at Rs 3,965 each, to raise Rs 57.6 crore, as per filings sourced from business intelligence platform Tofler.

title: Congress-led standing committees made several suggestions to improve lives of Indians: Rahul Gandhi
desc: Rahul Gandhi highlighted the Congress-led standing committees' efforts to improve Indian lives during the Budget session. Suggestions included legal MSP and stubble compensation for farmers, MNREGA expansion, teacher recruitment, paper leak reforms, and better Anganwadi worker pay. The External Affairs Committee emphasized migrant worker safeguards.

title: Tariffs on cocoa growers give edge to Europe’s chocolatiers
desc: This could lead to increased prices for consumers, reduced demand, and decreased competitiveness for US chocolate exports, potentially harming poverty-stricken cocoa farmers.

title: Chanakya Opportunities Fund bets big on Renewable Energy, invests in Sadbhav Future Tech’s Rs 36 crore round
desc: Chanakya Opportunities Fund has invested in Sadbhav Future Tech’s ₹36 crore pre-IPO round, supporting its solar pump-led agri-renewable mission to empower 1 million farmers over 10 years. The fund aligns with the company’s vision of sustainable rural energy transformation.

title: Donald Trump's core voter base may be the first to benefit as President urgently plans farmer bailout amid tariffs fallout
desc: American farmers are facing losses due to global retaliatory tariffs. The Trump administration plans a relief package for them to counteract the impact. Retaliatory tariffs from countries like China and Canada have led to reduced U.S. agricultural exports and lower crop prices. The administration is working with lawmakers to arrange funding for long-term damage.

title: Stir to go on till demands met, farmer leaders to attend May 4 talks with Centre: Dallewal
desc: Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal stated that the farmers' agitation will persist until the government concedes to their demands, including a legal MSP guarantee. Despite security challenges, farmers are determined to press their demands in the proposed May 4 talks with the Centre. 'Kisan Mahapanchayats' are being organized across Punjab to sustain the momentum.

title: Punjab farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal ends his indefinite hunger strike
desc: Punjab farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal ended his indefinite fast, initiated on November 26 to demand a legal guarantee on the minimum support price for crops, following appeals from Union Ministers. The decision was announced at a 'Kisan Mahapanchayat' after ministers advocated for his health and proposed further discussions.

title: 'Anxious': US farmers see tariffs threaten earnings
desc: US farmers are facing lower crop prices due to President Trump's new global tariffs, which went into effect this weekend. The resultant higher costs and threats of retaliation from trading partners, particularly China, are poised to significantly hurt American agriculture and its market competitiveness.

title: “Menstrual cycles in transgender men”? Donald Trump’s USDA head kills $600K grant with one misleading post
desc: A $600,000 grant awarded to Southern University to develop sustainable menstrual products has been abruptly revoked after officials misrepresented it as transgender-focused research. The project aimed to replace synthetic hygiene items with natural fibres like regenerative cotton and support local farmers in Louisiana. But a single line in the application mentioning transgender men was weaponised by Trump’s cost-cutting agency DOGE, led by Elon Musk. The fallout has endangered researchers, ignited backlash, and fuelled fears about the politicisation of science and women's health.

title: NABARD extends Rs 5,830 cr assistance to Jharkhand in FY25 to augment rural infra
desc: NABARD has extended record assistance of Rs 5,830 crore to Jharkhand in the 2024-25 fiscal year, significantly boosting rural infrastructure. The support included funds for irrigation projects, rural development, financial inclusion, and tribal empowerment, impacting over two lakh farmers and 50,000 rural families.

title: Govt expands Oil Palm Scheme to Assam’s tea estates, say planters
desc: The Union Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare will extend the NMEO-OP scheme to Assam's tea estates for oil palm cultivation. This decision follows NETA's appeal due to land classification issues. The initiative will support growing oil palm on five percent of tea garden land, aiding economic challenges in the tea industry.

title: Citi, SBI announce $295 million facility for small farmers
desc: Citi and State Bank of India (SBI) launched a $295 million social loan facility to support India's small farmers by improving their productivity and income. Citi's Trade & Working Capital Solutions will provide the loan, which SBI will use to finance its Kisan Credit Card loans, targeting financial inclusion for farmers with small landholdings.

title: Odisha makes first-ever global export of Moringa, Parwal to Dubai
desc: Odisha exported drumstick (moringa) and pointed gourd (parwal) internationally for the first time, shipping 910 kg to Dubai via Bhubaneswar airport. The state has exported over 52 MT of fresh produce in FY25, supported by FPOs and government initiatives. Odisha is enhancing cold storage and logistics to boost agri-exports and integrate farmers into global markets.

title: Bengaluru: After milk and diesel price hikes, Shivakumar hints at water tariff increase
desc: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar announced a probable one paisa per litre increase in Bengaluru's water tariff. He defended the hike and criticized the BJP for opposing measures intended to support farmers. Shivakumar emphasized that the water tariff hike would be minimized and that the Bengaluru Water Supply and Sewerage Board has incurred significant losses.

title: Bengaluru techie from farming background urges city people not to waste food: Know the 'pain of farmers who grow it'
desc: An engineer from Bengaluru shared his anguish on social media, urging people to avoid wasting food and highlighting the struggles of farmers. He recounted his family's dedication to agriculture and the harsh realities they face, including being forced to sell crops at a loss. This plea emphasizes the dire conditions and exploitation in the farming sector.

title: "Will personally take farmers to meeting with Center on May 4": Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann
desc: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann supports the farmers' movement and plans to take them for talks with the Center on May 4. He emphasizes that the protest is aimed at the central government and highlights Punjab's challenges, including combating drugs without harsh measures.

title: Jagjit Singh Dallewal has not ended indefinite fast, says farmer leader
desc: Punjab farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal has not ended his indefinite hunger strike despite accepting water after detained farmers were released, said his close aide Abhimanyu Kohar. The Punjab government claimed Dallewal broke his fast, but close aides clarify he remains on strike until their demands for legal MSP guarantees are met. Farmers were detained and then released following protests at Khanauri and Shambhu borders.
